title: cherry88
author: cherry88
content: Stacksbowers.com recently had another auction with a number of loaded Casascius coins.All were graded by PCGS.There's no announcement on pcgs.com that they are now grading Casascius coins. Curious if grading is open to the public or if this grading was limited to a private collection for the auction.

comments.author: cherry88
comments.body: QuoteWelcome to the forum cherry. Cheers!QuotePCGS is doing all the grading for stacks bowers.So to get a cas coin graded by PCGS, you must auction it off through stacks bowers?

comments.author: blucepheus
comments.body: Quote from: cherry88 on June 21, 2022, 10:19:17 PMQuoteWelcome to the forum cherry. Cheers!QuotePCGS is doing all the grading for stacks bowers.So to get a cas coin graded by PCGS, you must auction it off through stacks bowers?No, you may submit coins directly to PCGS. You need to sign up for a membership on their website, complete an online form, print out the completed forms, mail the coin(s) to them... and, voila!https://www.pcgs.com/

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: I sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. Steeley

comments.author: thiago007
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. SteeleyI'm curious, do you trust when they are high value coins?  I have a couple but I haven't had the courage to send them

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: thiago007 on June 22, 2022, 12:38:23 AMQuote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. SteeleyI'm curious, do you trust when they are high value coins?  I have a couple but I haven't had the courage to send themMight be worth calling them and asking if in-person drop off/pick-up are availableFrom what I know most/all of them also offer 1/same day grading for this purpose.ANACS and ICG both offer walk in service if you let them know before hand.

comments.author: jackpotato
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on June 22, 2022, 12:42:02 AMQuote from: thiago007 on June 22, 2022, 12:38:23 AMQuote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. SteeleyI'm curious, do you trust when they are high value coins?  I have a couple but I haven't had the courage to send themMight be worth calling them and asking if in-person drop off/pick-up are availableFrom what I know most/all of them also offer 1/same day grading for this purpose.ANACS and ICG both offer walk in service if you let them know before hand.Hi,MJwhich one do you think is a better choice for grading cryptocurrency coins,the PCGS,ANACS or ICG.it is really problem for the shipping,especially the international shipping,there are still some risk to be considered.

comments.author: jackpotato
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. SteeleyOh,4 months,that's too slow.

comments.author: blucepheus
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. SteeleyDid you choose a lesser service than Express?

comments.author: blucepheus
comments.body: Quote from: jackpotato on June 22, 2022, 04:14:47 AMQuote from: minerjones on June 22, 2022, 12:42:02 AMQuote from: thiago007 on June 22, 2022, 12:38:23 AMQuote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. SteeleyI'm curious, do you trust when they are high value coins?  I have a couple but I haven't had the courage to send themMight be worth calling them and asking if in-person drop off/pick-up are availableFrom what I know most/all of them also offer 1/same day grading for this purpose.ANACS and ICG both offer walk in service if you let them know before hand.Hi,MJwhich one do you think is a better choice for grading cryptocurrency coins,the PCGS,ANACS or ICG.it is really problem for the shipping,especially the international shipping,there are still some risk to be considered.This isn't directed to me, but I sense that ICG is the gold standard these days. I've had very positive experiences with them. Their submission process is straightforward, customer service good, and they have in-house crypto experts to validate the coins.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: blucepheus on June 22, 2022, 04:30:12 AMQuote from: jackpotato on June 22, 2022, 04:14:47 AMQuote from: minerjones on June 22, 2022, 12:42:02 AMQuote from: thiago007 on June 22, 2022, 12:38:23 AMQuote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. SteeleyI'm curious, do you trust when they are high value coins?  I have a couple but I haven't had the courage to send themMight be worth calling them and asking if in-person drop off/pick-up are availableFrom what I know most/all of them also offer 1/same day grading for this purpose.ANACS and ICG both offer walk in service if you let them know before hand.Hi,MJwhich one do you think is a better choice for grading cryptocurrency coins,the PCGS,ANACS or ICG.it is really problem for the shipping,especially the international shipping,there are still some risk to be considered.This isn't directed to me, but I sense that ICG is the gold standard these days. I've had very positive experiences with them. Their submission process is straightforward, customer service good, and they have in-house crypto experts to validate the coins.They do and I have actually helped them once or twice when certain coins come in ANACS no longer grades cryptocurrency themed coins/tokens, but still available for normal numismatic coinsPCGS has just started grading our coins and seems limited right now to larger makers like Casascius, Lealana, BTCC...  but definitely hope the expandYes, always a risk when shipping...  even with this pullback to 2017 prices, still a small price to pay for a plane ticket and in-person grading versus worrying about a lost coin in the mailAnd now with many countries easing the vaccination requirements, will make it better for certain collectors

comments.author: Gatorelf
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on June 22, 2022, 12:30:13 AMI sent 6 coins to them in Feb. I still haven't received them back, moving very slow. SteeleyPCGS Takes about five to six months lately for standard service, my last batch using express took two months. Which is still a long time to me

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on June 22, 2022, 11:24:16 AM✂ANACS no longer grades cryptocurrency themed coins/tokens, but still available for normal numismatic coins✂i still find anacs to be my favorite in terms of boxing style and i think it is a real shame that they have discontinued the service for cryptocurrencies have a lot of anacs graded coins in my collection and what else comes me not in the house

I've had very positive experiences with them. Their submission process is straightforward, customer service good, and they have in-house crypto experts to validate the coins.No, sadly. However, I'ts not really a problem I did this out of curiosity versus due to an urgent need. I wanted to learn how long their general service would take and how good it was once I received the coins. I will make a thread to give a report when it all happens.

comments.author: yimfinity
comments.body: Quote from: cygan on June 22, 2022, 04:49:33 PMQuote from: minerjones on June 22, 2022, 11:24:16 AM✂ANACS no longer grades cryptocurrency themed coins/tokens, but still available for normal numismatic coins✂i still find anacs to be my favorite in terms of boxing style and i think it is a real shame that they have discontinued the service for cryptocurrencies have a lot of anacs graded coins in my collection and what else comes me not in the house same. it's very much a personal preference as i know a lot of members here prefer the ICG slab. the wavy edge slab design looks a bit kiddish to me personally but any slab is better than no slab imo.

comments.author: cygan
comments.body: do any of you know very good and massive storage boxes especially for the format of anacs graded coins?i would like to store all my anacs graded coins in one of these boxes but i cant find anything suitable here in germany...

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Just noticed this article...If you are a member of PCGS, they are able to send you "Rare Coin Market Report" magazine as part of your subscriptionI usually just page through it and recycle it, but a new article/section caught my eye.Think this is a first for PCGS/magazine

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Apparently PCGS is now grading Casascius bearer bars!!  https://www.pcgs.com/valueview/bitcoin/2011-100-btc-casascius-gold-bar/203114?sn=903564&h=pophttps://www.pcgs.com/pop/detail/category/203114?l=bitcoin&ccid=203114&sn=903564&pn=1&ps=100It doesn't state the grade, but looks like from the drop down, that it at least got an "MS" designation:
